title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: It was a great process and they asked great questions. The interview process was long but very rewarding and I felt they really wanted to know me. The HR office was east to work with and made the job change process seamless.
Interview Questions: Explain what you can bring to Georgia Southern University and it’s factually, staff, and students.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Interview lasted no more than 10 minutes. I was hired at the end of the interview. I had a very good experience. They asked basic generic interview questions.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do in your spare time?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions:
Simple questions and no HR related questions.
Multiple rounds of interview but no follow-up on application status  The salary appeared to be low for skilled interview professionals. Lacked diversity representation throughout the process
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate for the position?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: They will conduct a phone screening first and if they like you, they will have you move onto an in person interview. The in person interview is long and repetative.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: One virtual. Prioritization of problem solving. Basic tech troubleshooting ability. Tell me about your self. When was a time you got stuck and how did you go about figuring it out
Interview Questions: One virtual. Prioritization of problem solving. Basic tech troubleshooting ability. Tell me about your self. When was a time you got stuck and how did you go about figuring it out

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: GAAP Day Interview. I was able to be set up with different interviewers. I interviewed with Housing and the Office of Leadership of Community and Engagement, as well as the Office of Fraternity and sorority.
Interview Questions: How will you be able to keep up with classes and our events

title: Alumni Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: They make you put in a lot of work and time for a position that does not pay enough. They ask basic interview questions over and over. Interview process was 4 hours long.
Interview Questions: Typically interview questions repeated over and over, just worded differently.

title: Assistant Professor of Elementary Science Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process very well organized, and the whole process was very expedite. They had to cancel one of my interviews because the person didn't show up, but we re-scheduled.
Interview Questions:
How do you fit in this position?
Why did appeal to you from this University?

title: Student Web Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Savannah, GA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: This was a remote interview with questions about SEO, Accessibility, QA, and Wordpress. The interview took approximately 40 minutes to answer the questions and conclude the interview. There was no technical portion of the interview, just a normal question based interview.
Interview Questions: What does Search Engine Optimization mean to you?

title: Admissions Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: You will have to give a presentation on a topic in front of other people in Admissions. For me, this was about 30 people and I got to pick any college admission topics for a 10 minute presentation.
Interview Questions: If you did not attend Georgia Southern be prepared to answer how you could recruit well for them. If you did, plan to share about your student experience.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions:
• Research on power system stability and Autonomous EVs (Two publications).
• Maintain laboratory 5S and managed up to 30 undergraduate student lab projects.
• Assist lab manager in testing, managing, and operating a variety of laboratory equipment.
Interview Questions:
• Research on power system stability and Autonomous EVs (Two publications).
• Maintain laboratory 5S and managed up to 30 undergraduate student lab projects.
• Assist lab manager in testing, managing, and operating a variety of laboratory equipment.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions:
I had only one interview, which took place over the phone with just one professor.  

I believe they were trying to replace someone who had accepted their offer but suddenly changed their mind.  As such, the department needed to find a replacement instructor quickly.
Interview Questions: You're Ph.D. is in what field exactly?

title: Sport Programs Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Savannah, GA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: long and detailed process, got to meet all of the people who worked for campus recreation at the university and get a good look into what the department was like.
Interview Questions: What sports would I add to the program if I could.

title: Licensed Professional Counselor Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: It was an over the phone interview followed by numerous in-person interviews on the actual campus. The interview questions were straight forward with a few scenarios. They provide you with the scenarios beforehand which was helpful.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Counseling Center?

title: Peer Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included a formal application, questionnaire based on potential issues, and a in-person group interview. The interview process was thorough and made to only select the best possible candidates.
Interview Questions: What is something you would encourage your students to do or how would you aid them?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very relaxed. I interviewed for a position in Game Operations. It was over the phone, and lasted no longer than 15 minutes. I was asked the very standard/basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: was over zoom and had pretty general questions at first. Later on they started to ask more difficult technical questions but they don't really expect you to know them. Overall not to bad
Interview Questions: what did you do at your previous job

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: They did not call or email me at all for this position. I was shocked to realize I did not even have an email stating that they did not want to move forward with my application. I believe it was due to not as much experience as they wanted, but an email would of been professional and nice.
Interview Questions: They did not contact me.

title: Student Graphic Design Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, you go to the job posting submit your resume, tell a little about yourself, submit your portfolio. Then you get contacted if they want to interview you, after that they call you either offering the position to you or telling you that they are not moving forward with your application.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stressful situations?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview and was explained a daily work day. I was led around to different labs and explained what different machines worked and what work would need to be completed in it.
Interview Questions: Can you take instructions once and be able to complete the work?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: They asked about an experience with talking with people on the phone and how good my communication skills were. They were also flexible with schedule times and said if any issues arise that conflict with the shedule, then they would work a way around the issue.
Interview Questions: Q: Name an example where you help someone with an issue.

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions:
Like any other interview. 
Asked common questions like your availability and what would you do in this situation. 
Most of the applicants were college students so availability was expected to be limited so most applicants were part time.
Interview Questions: What is your availability like?

title: Assessment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The best interview experience I've ever had. I appreciated the transparency of everyone involved. I left with a clear sense of the job responsibilities and felt confident it was a good fit.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a professor who says assessment is a waste of time?

title: Project Manager I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a unique, good experience. Responding to the recruiter email, I told them I wouldn't be able to start for some time due to current work projects.  I was not actively pursuing a new career at this time.  Got an email back to make a phone call.  Call was very pleasant and cordial and said their timetable wouldn't work out with mine.  Don't see too many callbacks for null candidates any more.  I appreciated it!
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: First Shift Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Once application was submitted, took about 4 weeks for an interview once accepted interview type was group panel, skill qualification questions, floor tech procedures, customer service. Took about another week for job offer notified  by mail for orientation  started the same week.
Interview Questions: Are you afraid of heights?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I participated in interviews with the search committee, students and presented during an open forum. My topic related to the job and allowed me to share my thoughts on what was needed for the role and the future of the unit.
Interview Questions:
What is your experience with supervision? 
How many people have you supervised? 
What would be your first priority in the role?

title: Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied within the window stated on their website.  Contacted within a few days of the closing date and scheduled interview for the next week.  Fairly standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with pressure from others, either inside or outside of the department, to alter your findings?

title: Media Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a tidous result and not needed. if they are going to require a specific dress code. Please don't be streotyping.   It always makes someone look ignorant
Interview Questions: The overall experience taught my more about myself.

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: Initial Phone Interview, Conference call, On campus-interview with presentation. Met with multiple employees in the office and was introduced. Presented on a topic dealing with admissions in front of office. Got a tour of campus.
Interview Questions: When has there been a time when you've had to work with others and how did you handle that?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very informal process of meeting with your department supervisors. Minimal questions about previous employment, and no surprising or silly questions but they spent a lot of time discussing ongoing projects and making sure that the employee understands how to balance work and class attendance.
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Jody Rushing was the one who runs the show in the department; she was the one who interviewed me and then hired me. She saw my application online, called to set up an interview within three days, and then offered me the position on the spot after an in-person interview. She is does call references and she is impressed with solid interpersonal skills.
Interview Questions: What does your class schedule look like?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with the interviewer and his assistant. He asked me what I would do in certain "difficult" scenarios presented by students, as well as a few personal questions to try and get to know my personality.
Interview Questions: You get done with the lesson early today, there's 10 minutes left in class, what do you do, let them go early or find something to do for 10 minutes?

title: Student Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called in to an interview. There were one on one stations  in a big room. No drug screening. I was notified that I had the job in about 2-3 weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions: Are you a punctual person?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a comfortable process. The person that interviewed me was qualified and extremely professional and nice.  She was prepared for the interview and was not late. The interviewing session last roughly 25-30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How will this position help with my future career aspirations

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then was called in for an interview. The interview was pretty straight forward. They called me to the store and I went into one of the back rooms for an interview. They went over my resume and asked me about how well do I work with others. They also asked if I had any experience as a cashier as well if I ever worked in eagle dinning before.
Interview Questions: Standard Star Method interview

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Emailing the department chair and being scheduled by the administrative assistant. Then the interview took place on the scheduled day. The interviewer was nice and polite. I was told what my responsibilities would be and hours if I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weaknesses

title: Concessions Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I was contacted by phone to do an interview. I came in and interviewed with one of the managers who was really sweet and pleasant. After interviewing, I got a phone call saying I got the job and telling me when to come in for orientation and training.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Student Line Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: A manager sat me down at an empty table in Land rum, and asked to ensure that all the information on my sheet was correct. She asked me a few questions and after the questions when I could start.
Interview Questions: What hours can you work?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with several parties during the interview process which included the search committee, a secondary committee, and several individuals.  All were professional, asked relevant questions and seemed interested in my professional endeavors.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
First round: Phone interview
Standard questions. Nothing surprising.

Second round: Campus visit involved presenting on a topic sent earlier, meeting with various administrators and interviewing with search committee. Nothing surprising or incredibly challenging here. Good opportunity to see campus, and visit facilities/coworkers.
Interview Questions: Asked to prepare presentation on topic directly relating to my understanding on role and my vision for the role.

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online & 2 weeks later invited for face to face within 3 days. F2f with admin coordinator & assistant director. Casual, laid back environment. Offered the position 2 months later.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Strengths?
Weaknesses?

title: Loader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple. You apply online through the Georgia Southern website. Once you have applied you will get a call to meet the supervisor. The supervisor will walk you around the warehouse while speaking with you about past experience and what it's like to work there.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview. Interviewers seemed really nice and welcoming. Had two interviews with both managers of the facility. They asked a few questions about my work history and my personality and how i felt i would best fit into the company.
Interview Questions: What was one of the hardest work situation youve had to deal with thus far?

title: Custodial Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: We were in a group setting in a circle and the interviewer went around in a circle and asked us questions about our selves then they told us about the job and we had to remember parts. Then when he was finished he randomly picked people to answer questions from what he told us about the job and university
Interview Questions: Can you stand and walk for hours

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: No interviews, online application only, position was offered as part of a graduate degree program. TA positions are typically offered to most incoming graduate students with ample teaching or research experience. Some internal research positions require interviews, however your typical research assistanceship is only offered to graduate students. Similar situation for gradute assistantships.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with director and other employees I would be working with if hired. Simple questions were asked about my class schedule, degree, and what type of work experience I had in the past.
Interview Questions: Where I wanted to be in five years.

title: Departmental Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted in three one on one steps.  First interview was with the departmental secretary, the second the professor in charge of the tutoring program, and the final a more informal meeting with the department chair.  Each meeting and conversation built upon the previous, but did not appear to become any more difficult.  The interviewers appeared to be much more interested in getting to know me as an individual as opposed to screening a potential candidate.  The entire procedure was extremely relaxed and low key.
Interview Questions: Have you had any teaching or tutoring experience in the past?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Get picked up at the airport, driven around town, pay for your own meals (reimbursement possible). Faculty get interviewed by the chair, the dean, and a committee, as well as whatever group of people assemble at lunch and dinner. Interviews are typically a grueling two day affair for new faculty.
Interview Questions: Who are the rhetorical theorists you most admire and have based your work on?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is very slow.
Interview Questions: None. Basic stuff.

title: SharePoint Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position online at Eagle Career website. Then went in to interview and the next week was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Do you have any database experience?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia Southern University (Statesboro, GA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for the position. I was called approximately 2 weeks after the posted closing date to set up a phone interview to occur in 1 week. The phone interview consisted of several technically specific questions about the field. Approximately 1 week later I was called to set up an in-person interview with 3 people. Both of the people asked me about 5 technically specific questions each along with some background information questions. After the in-person interview, I was contacted 1 week later with a job offer which I accepted.
Interview Questions: Please describe a typical day for the job you are applying for.
